titles.title: Recognizing the 75th anniversary of the discovery of the East Texas Oil Field on October 3, 1930, and the 25th anniversary of the East Texas Oil Museum.
Recognizing the 75th anniversary of the discovery of the East Texas Oil Field on October 3, 1930, and the 25th anniversary of the East Texas Oil Museum.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Air Quality.

bill.summary:
Recognizes the 25th anniversary of the East Texas Oil Museum in Kilgore, Texas, established by the family of the late Mr. H.L. Hunt and the Placid Oil Company.
Honors the pioneers and developers of discovery in the oil fields of East Texas, including the thousands in the fields who assured our country economic prosperity and success during the Second World War; and offers East Texans sincere wishes on this memorial event in their storied history.
